cookieBanner.text: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.

project.title: Fading Hell
project.description: A music project that I'm currently working on.

about.title: About
about.descriptionOne: Hello, I am Andrej Koller, a web developer specializing in frontend and backend development.
about.descriptionTwo: Aside from coding, I am passionate about playing the piano and organ, aiming to create unique and atmospheric performances. Through music, I seek to inspire and motivate others by sharing meaningful and uplifting pieces.

introduction.title: About
introduction.subtitle: Bridging Code, Creativity, and Curiosity
introduction.descriptionOne: Thank you for taking the time to learn more about me. My days are largely filled with planning and programming, where I focus on web development and data management. I'm always eager to expand my knowledge, explore new technologies, and refine my skills. If you're interested in the specific tools and programming languages I work with, feel free to check out my GitHub profile.
introduction.descriptionTwo: If you're curious about my projects, I encourage you to explore my GitHub for both current and future uploads. You'll find all relevant links at the end of each page.
introduction.descriptionThree: Beyond programming, music plays a vital role in my life. Playing classical piano and organ allows me to immerse myself in different musical worlds, shaped by composers such as Satie, Schumann, Mozart, and Chopin. I have a deep passion for forgotten and lesser-known organ music, both historical and contemporary, and enjoy uncovering lost works to bring them back to life. Through my YouTube channel, I share a unique collection of organ and piano recordings, showcasing the beauty of these instruments across various styles. If you're interested in collaborating on musical projects, feel free to reach out—I'm always open to new connections.

instruments.title: Instruments
instruments.descriptionOne: A Yamaha YDP 164B, an 88-key digital piano with fully weighted keys that replicate the feel of an acoustic grand.

thankYou.descriptionOne: I want to thank everyone who truly listens to me and understands me—especially through my music.

notification.text: This piece is currently in production. A video performance will be available soon.

gymnopedies.title: Trois Gymnopédies
gymnopedies.description: Érik Satie composed these three brief and atmospheric compositions in 3/4 time, each of which shares a common theme and structure. When experienced, they release a sentimental longing for the past or the bittersweet unknown. A time and place where you have never been before.

oversky.title: Oversky
oversky.description: Luke Howard - 'Oversky' is an atmospheric piano piece characterized by gentle, floating melodies and a melancholic yet hopeful mood. With its minimalist, neoclassical composition, it evokes the image of a vast sky, where delicate sounds drift like passing clouds.

lesFeuillesMortes.title: Les Feuilles Mortes
lesFeuillesMortes.description: Jean-Michel Blais' interpretation of Les Feuilles Mortes captures the nostalgic essence of the classic French song while infusing it with his signature contemporary neoclassical style. His delicate touch on the piano brings out the melancholic beauty of falling autumn leaves, evoking a sense of longing and reflection. With soft, flowing melodies and subtle dynamic shifts, the piece feels intimate and cinematic, as if carrying the listener through a quiet, golden-hued autumn afternoon.

gnossiennes.title: Gnossiennes
gnossiennes.description: Satie's Gnossiennes exist in a realm beyond traditional form or time. Without bar lines or conventional tempo, they drift like musical incense—weightless, enigmatic, and inward. The melodies feel ancient and unfamiliar, as though they were unearthed rather than written, and the harmonies wander with an almost ritualistic logic. Silence is not merely a pause here; it becomes a partner to the notes, shaping meaning through absence as much as presence.

vexations.title: Vexations
vexations.description: Vexations is an enigmatic and haunting work written for solo piano. Its slow, dissonant theme—meant to be repeated 840 times—invites the listener into a trance-like state that blurs the line between time and emotion. The piece evokes a sense of quiet introspection, as if wandering endlessly through the corridors of the mind, searching for something lost or never known.

nocturneEFlatMajor.title: Nocturne in E-flat Major, Op. 9 No. 2
nocturneEFlatMajor.description: Chopin’s Nocturne in E-flat Major is a tender meditation on beauty, longing, and stillness. Flowing with lyrical grace, the piece opens like a gentle whisper, its ornamented melody unfolding over a softly pulsing accompaniment. Each phrase seems to sigh, as if recalling something half-remembered — a dream, a memory, a fleeting touch.

inspiration.title: Inspiration
inspiration.descriptionOne: This is a collection of the gems that have sustained me over time: inspirational quotes,

itemOne.quote: “Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love.”
itemOne.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky, The Brothers Karamazov

itemTwo.quote: “To achieve great things, two things are needed; a plan, and not quite enough time.”
itemTwo.author: Leonard Bernstein

itemThree.quote: “To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.”
itemThree.author: Robert Schumann

itemFour.quote: “But how could you live and have no story to tell?”
itemFour.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky, White Nights

itemFive.quote: “If and when you fall in love, may you be happy with her. I don't need to wish her anything, for she'll be happy with you. May your sky always be clear, may your dear smile always be bright and happy, and may you be for ever blessed for that moment of bliss and happiness which you gave to another lonely and grateful heart. Isn't such a moment sufficient for the whole of one's life?”
itemFive.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky, White Nights

itemSix.quote: “Whoever saves one life saves the world entire.”
itemSix.author: Stern, Schindler's List

itemSeven.quote: “In order to be able to think, you have to risk being offensive.”
itemSeven.author: Jordan B. Peterson

itemNine.quote: “Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.”
itemNine.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

itemTen.quote: “He was despised and rejected by mankind, a man of suffering, and familiar with pain. Surely he took up our pain and bore our suffering, yet we considered him punished by God. But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was on him, and by his wounds we are healed. We all, like sheep, have gone astray; each of us has turned to our own way; and the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all. He was oppressed and afflicted, yet he did not open his mouth; he was led like a lamb to the slaughter. After he has suffered, he will see the light of life and be satisfied; by his knowledge my righteous servant will justify many, and he will bear their iniquities.”
itemTen.author: Isaiah 53, summary
